thread.title: Watch Take That join starstruck James Corden for Carpool Karaoke's Red Nose Day special
thread.title_full: Watch Take That join starstruck James Corden for Carpool Karaoke's Red Nose Day special

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Watch Take That join starstruck James Corden for Carpool Karaoke's Red Nose Day special
text:
Watch Take That join starstruck James Corden for Carpool Karaoke's Red Nose Day special Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Take That join James Corden for Carpool Karaoke Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
James Corden did a special edition of Carpool Karaoke for Red Nose Day tonight – with Take That on board. 
Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen joined James in his car for the show. 
The boys donned red noses as they kicked off the karaoke with their smash hit Shine. 
Then James asked the awkward question – "Who will be next to leave the band?" Take That joined James Corden for a Red Nose Day special of Carpool Karoke (Photo: BBC) The boys sang Take That's hits (Photo: BBC) 
"If I leave, Gary and Mark will be alright," Howard admitted. 
But despite the band's depleted numbers – since the departure of Robbie Williams and Jason Orange – The Late Late Show host still had a great time. 
"For me as a take that fan to be in this car right now is unreal for me," James said, tearing up. They did a rendition of Never Forget (Photo: BBC) Fans called for James to join the band (Photo: BBC) 
They then burst into an emotional rendition of Greatest Day. 
"It's beautiful! Wembley we'll see you soon," James joked. 
The boys finished with an impassioned blast of Never Forget – and fans loved it. 
"Starting a petition for James Corden to be a full time member of Take That," one fan tweeted. 
"Watching Take That Carpool and I'm like a young girl again!" another added. 
A third viewer tweeted: "This Carpool Karaoke is super brilliant because James is a proper fan and that's really coming across." Like us on Facebook
